title: Help with text detection on images. Don't know if it's bad preprocessing on the image or bad configuration of the detection engine.
author: t2_qoadpdb
text:
So, I am working on a script to detect the texts printed on credit cards (I work with it, it's not for illegal purposes), but I'm getting pretty crap results, and I don't know if the preprocessing that i'm applying to the image is bad, or if I'm not configuring the tesseract engine properly.

Here are the librarys I'm using:

* The preprocessing is being done with OpenCV wrapper in Python.
* The OCR I'm using is tessract with the PyTesseract wrapper. (I'm not passing much arguments to it as I don't know very much what I'm doing on it, so I'm simply using the  pytesseract.image\_to\_data function)

The image after the preprocessing: [https://ibb.co/vhkWwkq](https://ibb.co/vhkWwkq).

Should this image get better results or I must improve the preprocessing?  
Thanks a lot for the help guys.
